Name: HMS Acheron
Namesake: Acheron, a river in Greek mythology
Builder: John I. Thornycroft & Company, Woolston, Hampshire
Fate: Sunk, 17 December 1940 after hitting a mine
Badge: On a Field Black, barry wavy of 4 Silver.
Displacement:
1,350 long tons (1,370 t) (standard)
1,773 long tons (1,801 t) (deep load)
Range: 4,800 nmi (8,900 km; 5,500 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × single 4.7 in (120 mm) guns
2 × single 2-pdr (40 mm) AA guns
2 × quadruple 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes
6 × depth charges, 3 chutes
